intro: Stackhousia viminea var. occidentalis, commonly known as the western climbing lily, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, vine-like stems that can climb or trail along the ground. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas.
